sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer: Past efforts were btc/eth only and vendor locked. Ours is different: a single, open-source Odoo payment provider that makes ADA native across eCommerce, POS, and Invoicing on Odoo with dual-mode (self-custody receive-only or processor) with a simple switch, Orders and books update automatically, it installs like Stripe/PayPal, ships with an Odoo App Store.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer: Our MVP ships an Odoo eCommerce/Pos payment provider that ADA as a native payment in Odoo eCommerce and POS. At checkout or the till, customers pay with Lace, Nami, Eternl, or Flint via a QR/link with live status. On confirmation, orders auto-mark Paid, receipts/invoices reconcile, and stock updates with no manual steps. Merchants can choose self-custody (receive-only) or connect a processor (API + webhook). Edge cases, partials, overpays, expiry/refunds are handled. An admin dashboard shows payment history, with a demo store proving it on testnet/mainnet.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
We will build  Cardano Payments Gateway for Odoo an open-source payment acquirer that makes _ADA _a first-class option in Odoo eCommerce and Odoo POS (with Invoicing optional). It installs like Stripe/PayPal and lets merchants choose self-custody or a processor no lock-in.

How it addresses the problem

- **Native to Odoo**: ADA appears alongside existing methods; orders/receipts and accounting update automatically.
- **Simple checkout and in\-store pay**: Customers use familiar Cardano wallets like Lace, Nami, Eternl, Flint by clicking “Pay with ADA” or scanning a QR.
- **Lower ops friction**: No copy-paste or external dashboards; fewer errors and support tickets.
- **Open and scalable**: App Store listing, clear docs, and open-source code speed adoption.

**User Journeys**

**Odoo eCommerce**

1. Admin enables “Cardano (ADA)” and sets a processor API key + webhook—or a public wallet for self-custody.
2. Buyer chooses Cardano (ADA) at checkout and pays with Lace/Nami/Eternl/Flint.
3. Payment confirms; the order is marked Paid, inventory updates, and the invoice reconciles automatically.

**Odoo POS\(in\-store\)**

1. Cashier selects Cardano (ADA) as the tender.
2. POS shows a QR/payment link; the customer pays with Lace, Nami, Eternl, or Flint.
3. On confirmation, the sale closes; the receipt prints and daily totals include ADA—no manual steps.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
**Real\-world utility at scale**: Makes ADA a daily payment option inside Odoo,an ERP used by ~15M+ users with 16k+ partners—so Cardano moves  to commerce across retail, services, and subscriptions.



**Frictionless merchant onboarding**: Odoo merchants enable ADA like Stripe/PayPal (web + POS). Non-crypto-native SMEs join Cardano without new tools or workflows.



**Verifiable on\-chain growth**: Each order get a tx; we’ll publish an open dashboard (tx count, ADA volume, time-to-confirm, refund rates) so the community can audit adoption.



**Public good, open source**: Code released openly (Odoo-compatible licensing), with docs, tutorials, and packaging for the Odoo App Store easy to adopt, fork, and extend.



**Ecosystem flywheel**: More merchant payments increase wallet usage, create demand for Cardano stablecoins, explorers, analytics, and enable loyalty/DID receipts later, benefiting multiple Cardano projects.



**Global and inclusive reach**: Odoo’s on-prem and cloud footprint spans SMEs to large enterprises and government; this brings ADA to regions with high fees or limited card access.



**Launch & advocacy platform**: We’ll showcase at Odoo Experience and regional roadshows, educating decision-makers and directing them into the Cardano ecosystem (wallets, tooling, standards).



**Reusability beyond Odoo**: Patterns (CIP-13/30 UX, UTxO-aware reconciliation, webhook flows) can be copied to other ERPs/CMSs, multiplying Cardano’s real-world integrations.

sub_fields.answer: Core Architecture Prototype on Testnet

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer: A public GitHub repo delivering the core technical spine of the Odoo Cardano (ADA) payment acquirer on Cardano testnet. It includes: (1) an Odoo Payment Provider/Acquirer module with admin configuration UI, (2) per-order payment request generation for eCommerce checkout and basic POS tender (amount, address, QR/link), (3) wallet integration support by producing a wallet-friendly QR/link and validating payments using at least two Cardano wallets (e.g., Lace/Nami/Eternl/Flint), (4) a lightweight “watcher” service that detects testnet payments and triggers confirmations, (5) a secure webhook/callback endpoint in Odoo, and (6) a reproducible Docker setup (Odoo + Postgres + watcher) with step-by-step README.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer: Using only the README, a reviewer can deploy the Docker environment, enable the Cardano payment method, and complete at least one successful end-to-end testnet payment in eCommerce and one in POS using two different Cardano wallets. After payment, Odoo automatically updates the order to Paid (or equivalent) and shows invoice/stock updates. Webhooks are authenticated (shared secret/HMAC) and idempotent (retries do not duplicate payment updates). The watcher correctly matches payments to orders and applies the configured confirmation threshold.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: A GitHub tag/release link containing the Odoo module, watcher service, Docker compose files, env templates, and a README with “Reproduce This Demo” steps. An unlisted demo video (1–2 minutes) showing: enabling the provider, generating the payment QR/link, paying on testnet with two wallets, and the order changing to Paid in Odoo (web + POS). Screenshots/logs of watcher detection, webhook callbacks, and Odoo transaction updates are provided, along with anonymized testnet transaction IDs used in the demo.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
**High leverage integration**: One open-source module makes ADA a first-class tender across Odoo eCommerce and POS—a platform with millions of users. A single build unlocks many merchants and verticals, multiplying ecosystem impact.



**Public good, reusable code**: Delivered under open licenses with docs, tests, and demo flows. Other teams can fork the Cardano payment + webhook patterns (CIP-13 now, CIP-30 next) for different ERPs/CMSs—compounding value beyond this project.



**Measured, auditable outcomes**: Testnet-only scope keeps costs lean while proving feasibility. Success is tied to verifiable metrics (completed testnet payments, confirm times, refund rates) and milestone-gated deliverables (repo tags, videos, reports).





**Real adoption path, low lock\-in**: Self-custody by default and optional processor mode reduce barriers and long-term vendor costs for merchants, aligning with Cardano’s decentralization ethos and encouraging sustained use of ADA.





**Efficient use of funds**: Budget focuses on engineering, QA, docs, and a public no spend on production distribution. If just 50 merchants eventually activate from this foundation, the effective cost per merchant enabled is modest relative to traditional gateway integrations.





**Ecosystem flywheel**: Merchant payments drive wallet activity, analytics, and future add-ons (stablecoins, loyalty, DID receipts). The project seeds real-world utility that others in the Cardano stack can build on, maximizing the network’s ROI.
